alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 3:07PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 615 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 304 PM HST, radar indicated heavy showers over upcountry Maui falling at rates of 1 to 1.5 inches per hour. Heavy showers will persist over the next hour then diminish late afternoon and could produce elevated water in streams downslope. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kahului, Pukalani, Makawao, Kula, Haliimaile, Haiku-Pauwela, Paia, Pauwela, Keokea, Huelo, Puunene, Hookipa Beach Park, Kanaha Beach Park and Haleakala National Park. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 615 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
